description: From Middle French variation, from Old French variacion, from Latin variātiō.

entries.meaning: The act of varying; a partial change in the form, position, state, or qualities of a thing.

examples: When the process didn't work, we tried a variation.
All of his soups are variations on a single recipe.

entries.meaning: (nautical) The angular difference at the vessel between the direction of true north and magnetic north.
(board games) A line of play that differs from the original.

(music) A technique where material is repeated with alterations to the melody, harmony, rhythm, timbre, texture, counterpoint or orchestration; but with some invariant characteristic, e.g. a ground bass.
(genetics) The modification of a hereditary trait.
(astronomy) Deviation from the mean orbit of a heavenly body.
